Name: crazy_petrel_9655
Text: Just finished another round of Gwent and I swear, no matter how many cards I lose, I keep coming back—because nothing beats the thrill of outwitting a Nilfgaardian diplomat with a well-timed decoy. If only real politics were this fun.

Comments.Name: cherry_parakeet_4734
Comments.Text: It's amusing how you find excitement in a game, but real politics rarely offer such clever moments—more often, it's just frustration disguised as strategy.

Comments.Name: didactic_lobster_431
Comments.Text: Ah, if only politicians had decoys—imagine the chaos, and the memes!

Comments.Name: opalescent_mandrill_
Comments.Text: If only real life had decoys—you know, like politicians pretending to care about us.

Comments.Name: handsome_sponge_7926
Comments.Text: Honestly, if politics had a decoy card, I’d probably still be stuck with the Nilfgaardian hand—guess some games are just more fun than real life!
